snippet.title: China Miner Longplay (C64) [50 FPS]
snippet.description:
Developed by Ian Gray and published by Interceptor Software in 1984.

Follow me on Twitter: https://twitter.com/Al82_Retro
Add me on Google+: http://bit.ly/1tPwL1u

Foreword: You might notice the score change on the level "Don't Panic" - the original copy of the game I was using bugged out severely, so I used another copy and just skipped through to that level and continued playing from there.

I recently saw a video of this on another channel and, having looked it up, saw it had a reputation as being one of the hardest games on the C64. That seemed like a challenge worth checking out, so I fired it up.

It's basically a clone of Manic Miner with the main sprite given a conical hat, hence the title; the hat is as far as the Chinese theme actually goes. The objective is to collect all the objects on each screen before collecting the golden key to progress to the next screen.

The game is insanely hard to beat, but it's not actually broken. It's better to get to a safe place and analyse a route through the level before tackling it, especially as some levels have platforms that disappear once stepped on, making them impossible to complete if you don't act quickly enough.

Graphics are basic and you only get one music track (a version of Joplin's Maple Leaf Rag), but they do the job.

So, for those of you who wondered what the rest of the game looked like beyond the first level, this video is for you!

The ending sucks, but you already knew that...

Enjoy!
#retrogaming
